subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text: "Protuberance"? > "enlargement of an abdominal organ; pain due to splenomegaly" > "[dialectal] abdominal tumour".

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[enlargement]] or [[lump]] in the [[abdomen]]; in particular, [[splenomegaly]] or [[hepatomegaly]]
# {{lb|zh|TCM}} [[stuffiness]], [[fullness]] and [[discomfort]] in the [[epigastrium]]; [[dyspepsia]] or [[constipation]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal Mandarin}} [[abdominal]] [[tumour]]
# {{lb|zh|Min Dong|Min Nan}} [[scab]]; [[healed]] [[wound]]
# {{lb|zh|Min Nan}} [[scurf]]; [[flake]]s on the skin surface

subSections.title: Compounds
subSections.text: {{zh-der|痞塊|痞積|痞疾|痞氣|痞利|痞硬|痞脹|痞結|痞塞|痞滿}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
"Bad" > "obscene; ferocious; rascal". Its use is most prominent in dialects of [[Hubei]] and [[Hunan]], and possibly originates from the ancient dialectal pronunciation of {{zh-l|*匪|bad, evil, bandit}}, same as Min Nan {{zh-l|*歹|phái(ⁿ)|bad}}.

It may be the origin of some uses of {{zh-l|皮}}, for example {{zh-l|*調皮|naughty}}, {{zh-l|*賴皮|shameless}} and {{zh-l|*頑皮|naughty}}.

The Cantonese pronunciation is probably due to confusion with {{zh-l|踎|mau1|to squat}}, as this word is not native to Cantonese.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=pǐ
|c=mau1
|h=pfs=
|md=pī/pāi
|md_note=pī - "rascal"; pāi ({{zh-l|*歹}}) - "low, mean, shabby, seedy, obscene, shameful"
|mn=
|w=2phi
|cat=n
}}

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[rascal]]; [[scoundrel]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal}} to [[act]] [[perversely]]; to behave like a [[hoodlum]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal}} to [[act]] [[shamelessly]]; to [[violate]] [[rule]]s
# {{lb|zh|dialectal}} [[frivolous]]; [[slippery]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal}} [[obscene]]; [[indecent]]; [[vulgar]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal}} [[ferocious]]; [[fierce]]
# {{lb|zh|dialectal}} [[bad]]; [[evil]]
